abstract: Google tries to lure developers for its new phone software with prize money. And why not? A similar strategy appears to be working for Facebook.
snippet: Google tries to lure developers for its new phone software with prize money. And why not? A similar strategy appears to be working for Facebook.
lead_paragraph: One of the big challenges for Google’s ambitious phone project is persuading software developers to write interesting applications. Already, developers of mobile phone programs complain about having to write for too many different software platforms, like Windows Mobile, Symbian, Palm, RIM, and soon, Apple’s iPhone. And while those software platforms are already powering millions of phones, there are no phones out there running Google’s “Android” system — and there won’t be any until the second half of next year.

headline.main: Seeding the Google Phone With Apps
